text: a lot of Mormons I think are
uncomfortable actually with Mitt
Romney's bid for the presidency there is
a sense in the church and this goes back
to the 19th century when you know in in
the 1830s the state of Missouri issued
an extermination order saying that the
Mormons have to be driven out of the
state or all killed this was given by
the governor to the AR to the state
militia Joseph Smith was killed in NAU
the the Mormons fled to Utah then the
federal government followed them there
and Stamped Out polygamy arrests and you
know tearing all these families apart
and all of that Mormons are are really
have a fairly welldeveloped sense of
persecution and a sense that people
don't really understand them that the
nation might be hostile to them that
they could be again at any time um made
fun of or attacked or so on and so forth
a lot of Mormons feel that Mitt Romney's
campaign is sort of inviting that so
there are many Mormons who say you know
I wish you weren't running at all I wish
um I wish you is not coming to be presid
now there are others who say well no
this is good because this gives us a
chance to really unpack all of this
stuff and work through all of this
baggage and really become American in a
sense you know prove to the country that
they don't have anything to fear from us
and to prove that we are actually fully
American in 1904 Mormon apostle was
elected to the Senate and he entered the
Senate uh from the state of Utah and
there were three years of hearings over
whether or not the Senate would seat him
because he was a Mormon and would he
have divided loyalties right and there
was this big brew HaHa the Senate
debated this for three years eventually
he was confirmed he took his seat and he
turned out to be an utterly boring
middle of the road Republican senator
who helped cause the Great Depression
that proved to a lot of people well yeah
the Mormons are not going to try to
undermine their Republic um they're
they're going to be just like anybody
else are going to be boring Republicans
like Orin hatch is today right but uh
for the Mormons you know there is still
some apprehension about what M romy's
election might mean for them if it would
be a good thing or a bad thing
